newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal's EDP Q1 cons net up 21 pct. [CORRECTED 16:25 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Portugal's EDP Q1 cons net up 21 pct. [CORRECTED 16:25 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects and replaces earlier story that said EDP Q1 net profit rose 16 percent to 21 billion escudos.)
Portuguese state utility EDP-Electricidade de Portugal corrected its first quarter result and said that net consolidated profit rose 21 percent to 29.16 billion escudos, a spokesman said.

"The correct result is that the consolidated net profit of EDP in the first quarter was 29.16 billion escudos, up 21 percent from the first quarter of 1996," Antonio Castro, who is responsible for EDP's investor relations, told Reuters.
Earlier, EDP president Antonio de Almeida had told Reuters incorrectly that first quarter net profit had risen 16 percent to 21 billion escudos.
Castro said the 29.16 billion escudos profit figure was unaudited and must take into account that some provisions are only implemented at the end of the year.
